content.text: Use Fig. 1.1 to estimate the volume of the liquid

total mass =   .........  \(kg\)

Fig. 2.1 shows a brick
500 bricks like the one shown in Fig. 2.1 are stacked on a wooden platform, known as a pallet. The pallet of bricks is to be loaded on to a lorry by means of a fork-lift truck, as shown in Fig. 2.2
Each brick has a volume of \(0.0012 \text{m}^3\) and is made of a material of density \(2300 \text{kg} / \text{m}^3\)
The density of the brick in Fig. 2.3 is ............................................ the density
of the brick in Fig. 2.1, because
The mass of the brick in Fig. 2.3 is ............................................ the mass of the brick in Fig. 2.1

Complete the following sentences
State the two quantities, and their units, that must be measured in order to calculate the work done on the truck

the force exerted by the man,
the work done by the man,
the useful power of the man?
On another occasion, there is a smaller number of logs in the truck. The resistive force on the truck is smaller when the truck is pulled from P to Q at the same speed as before
What effect does this have on

section

The appearance of the oil in the manometer before connecting it to the container is shown in Fig. 6.1(a)

6 cm of oil less than atmospheric pressure

1. in the left-hand limb,
2. in the right-hand limb?

When the gas in the container is heated, the pressure rises
A manometer is being used to measure the pressure of the gas in a container, as shown
Fig. 6.1

Tick **two** boxes

filament lamp

Fig. 11.1 shows the cross-section of a horizontal wire carrying a current. The positioned between the poles of a large horseshoe magnet
